category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
Help me to love you, to hold onto you,
even though I used to embrace things that were wrong and sinful.
You loved me before I ever loved you back—
when I was an enemy, a sinner, feeling worthless.
You claimed me when I had written myself off;
You love me like your own child,
and your heart breaks for me.

Love brought you from heaven to earth, from earth to the cross,
and from the cross to the grave.
Because of love, you were exhausted, hungry, and tempted.
You were mocked, whipped, beaten, spat on, crucified, and pierced.
Love led you to bow your head and die.

My rescue is the place where my own imperfect love
and your perfect, divine love meet.
And you welcome me, not with the sadness and hurt of Joseph seeing his brothers,
but with love and pure joy.
Your love isn't on-and-off, cold, or always changing;
it doesn't stop or fade, no matter how much I push back.

Holiness is a spark of your love,
fanned into a fire in my heart by your Spirit,
so it always points back to you, where it came from.

Let me see your love all around me—not just at the cross,
but in my community of friends and in the world.
When I feel the sun's warmth, let me thank you,
the true source of all that is right and healing.
When I feel a gentle rain,
let me think of how your truth refreshes my soul.
When I walk by a river,
let me praise you for the hope that fills eternity with joy,
and makes me clean, giving me the right to eternal life.

Your infinite love is the greatest mystery,
and my forever peace is found in enjoying it forever.
